title: Bulgarian FA President Borislav Mihaylov steps down following racist abuse amid calls for his country's expulsion from Euro 2020
text:
The president of the Bulgarian FA has been forced to resign by his prime minister amid calls for the nation to face international footballing exile over the abuse of England's black players.

Borislav Mihaylov, the former national team goalkeeper who previously complained that the nation was being unfairly targeted, has quit before Uefa launches fresh sanctions which could lead to Euro 2020 expulsion.

Both Bulgaria and Uefa were facing criticism over their apparent inability to tackle discrimination on Tuesday, with Boris Johnson among leading figures piling pressure on the governing body to act swiftly over the latest "vile" abuse.

England's players were commended for their tough and dignified response to racism on Monday night, having twice stopped their Euro 2020 qualifying match after a chorus of monkey chants.

The governing body will launch its disciplinary process imminently, with a points and potential tournament disqualification within its remit after the nation failed to clean up its act following a partial stadium closure.

On Tuesday, the anti-discrimination organisation, Fare, which had three undercover spotters in the crowd, said tournament expulsion was now the only option. The spotters believed some of those behind the racist chanting had also been employed as stewards inside the Sofia stadium.
description: The president of the Bulgarian FA has been forced to resign by his prime minister amid calls for the nation to face international footballing exile over the abuse of England's black players.
